source.790156bf:
cat_col = [col for col in list(train_df.columns) if train_df[col].nunique()<15 if col not in ['id','song_popularity']]
num_col = [col for col in list(train_df.columns) if train_df[col].nunique()>=15 if col not in ['id','song_popularity']]
source.96c98176:
nrows = 2
ncols = 5
fig, axes = plt.subplots(nrows, ncols, figsize=(18, 10), facecolor='#EAEAF2')
count = 0
for c in range(5):
    for r in range(2):
        sns.kdeplot(x=num_col[count],hue='song_popularity',ax=axes[r, c],data = train_df,color='red', fill =True)
        count += 1
plt.show()
source.beec84dc:
nrows = 1
ncols = 3
fig, axes = plt.subplots(nrows,ncols, figsize=(18, 5))
count = 0

for r in range(nrows):
    for c in range(ncols):
        sns.countplot(x=cat_col[count],hue='song_popularity',data=train_df,ax=axes[c])
        count += 1
plt.show()

plot_df = pd.DataFrame({'feat_1':tsne_results[:,0],'feat_2':tsne_results[:,1],'target':train_df['song_popularity']})
plt.figure(figsize=(16,10))
sns.scatterplot(
    x="feat_1", y="feat_2",
    hue="target",
    data=plot_df,
    legend="full",
    alpha=1
)
plt.show()
